item.title: Covid: Millions could be self-isolating between now and 16 August
item.description: BBC analysis shows more than 4.5 million people could be asked to self-isolate before 16 August.

item.title: Euro 2020 semi-final England v Denmark: Bukayo Saka expected to start for England
item.description: Bukayo Saka is expected to start Wednesday's Euro 2020 semi-final with Denmark in place of Jadon Sancho.

item.title: Haiti President Jovenel Moïse killed in attack at home
item.description: Jovenel Moïse is shot dead and the first lady injured by gunmen in the capital, Port-au-Prince.

item.title: Record June temperatures point to more 'extraordinary' extremes
item.description: North America experienced its warmest June on record and experts say the figures are frightening.

item.title: Warnings of staff shortages due to self-isolation
item.description: Business groups say the delay in easing self-isolation rules will hit firms that rely on young workers.

item.title: Wembley park stabbings: Nicole and Bibaa's mother 'has no peace' after murder conviction
item.description: Mina Smallman says the man who murdered her daughters, Nicole and Bibaa, has "no power in our lives".

item.title: Ever Given: Ship that blocked Suez Canal sets sail after deal signed
item.description: The megaship Ever Given is finally leaving the Suez Canal after a deal is struck with Egypt.

item.title: Rebekah Vardy gets partial win in Coleen Rooney libel battle
item.description: A judge throws out some of Coleen Rooney's defence in the latest stage of the libel battle.

item.title: British and Irish Lions 2021: Two players isolating after member of management tests positive
item.description: Two British and Irish Lions players are isolating after a member of the management team tests positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Lady Lavinia Nourse: Ex-High Court judge widow in 'anonymity until charge' call
item.description: Lady Lavinia Nourse calls her two-week historical child sex abuse trial an "absolute nightmare".

item.title: England's excitement ahead of Euro 2020 semi-final
item.description: The nation shares high hopes and nerves ahead of the England vs Denmark semi-final at 20:00 BST.

item.title: Cannes Film Festival rolls out red carpet again after year off
item.description: Stars and photographers cram the red carpet for the first major film festival since the pandemic.

item.title: Big stars to play small shows as live music returns
item.description: Sir Tom Jones, Rag 'n' Bone Man and Sam Fender will all play grassroots venues over the summer.

item.title: The police defecting as a new civil war looms in Myanmar
item.description: As Myanmar heads towards a new civil war, the BBC hears from police officers who defected after the coup.

item.title: 'Probation officers are the forgotten part of the criminal justice system'
item.description: Probation officer Sam Gildersleeve shows us a job that often isn't seen in police shows.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Isolation insanity' and 'Beer we go' as England awaits
item.description: The papers consider the risks of extending isolation rules for the fully vaccinated as Euros fever builds.

item.title: Jimmy Carter and Rosalynn celebrate 75 years of marriage
item.description: Images of Jimmy and Rosalynn Carter as the former US presidential couple celebrate their anniversary.

item.title: Why North America's killer heat scares me
item.description: It's not the new record temperatures that concern the BBC's Roger Harrabin - it's the way they were smashed.

item.title: Dying too young: Maps show little has changed in 170 years
item.description: Why do areas with high Covid death rates match places with the worst health in Victorian times?

item.title: Ray BLK: Why debut album Access Denied has taken so long to make
item.description: The RnB singer felt lost after winning a huge award that she'd hoped would fast-track her to success.

item.title: Afghanistan withdrawal stokes fears of al-Qaeda comeback
item.description: An emboldened Taliban has raised the spectre of international terrorism making an unwelcome return.

item.title: How Paula Rego remains a master storyteller
item.description: The artist's new exhibition asserts her status as one of Britain's leading figurative painters.

item.title: The push to get Australian men and boys to open up
item.description: Australia is examining beliefs about what makes "real men" in a bid to reduce suicide and violence.

item.title: Russia hacking claims pose challenge for Biden
item.description: After a string of Russian-linked hacks, how will US President Joe Biden respond?

item.title: South Africa's match against Georgia cancelled over Covid-19 cases
item.description: South Africa's match against Georgia is cancelled because of Covid-19 cases in both teams, less than three weeks before the Springboks face the British and Irish Lions.

item.title: Euro 2020: England manager Gareth Southgate says he is only focused on semi-final against Denmark
item.description: England manager Gareth Southgate tells BBC Radio 5 Live's Emma Saunders he is solely focused on the semi-final against Denmark.

item.title: Euro 2020: Italy beat Spain on penalties after Morata miss
item.description: Watch the dramatic penalty shootout which saw Italy beat Spain 4-2 after their high-quality semi-final finished 1-1 in the semi-finals of the European Championship at Wembley.

item.title: Who are the players in England's new 18-man ODI squad?
item.description: The potential debutants, the familiar faces, the big opportunities. Who are the 18 players in England's new squad to face Pakistan?

item.title: 'The whole experience caught up with me' - Raducanu 'feeling better' after retiring
item.description: Emma Raducanu says the "whole experience" of her run to the Wimbledon fourth round "caught up" with her but is now "feeling better" after her mid-match retirement.

item.title: Euros 2020: What all of us can learn from Gareth Southgate
item.description: The England boss has turned to experts outside football to help prepare his team. Should we all take note?

item.title: England v Denmark: How Luke Shaw went from Jose Mourinho's fall-guy to Euro 2020 star
item.description: Humiliated by Jose Mourinho, Luke Shaw has recovered to become England's most creative attacking force at Euro 2020. So how has he done it?

item.title: Euro 2020: Denmark’s journey through the eyes of the country
item.description: Denmark are riding the crest of a wave at the European Championship, but how have those from the country seen the tournament and how far the team will go?

item.title: England v Denmark: Who made your England XI for semi-final against Denmark?
item.description: BBC Sport readers pick their starting XI for England's Euro 2020 semi-final against Denmark.

item.title: Gareth Southgate: Euro 2020 semi-final a 'very special opportunity' for England
item.description: England have a "very special opportunity" to make the country happy when they face Denmark in their Euro 2020 semi-final, says Gareth Southgate.

item.title: England v Denmark: Euro 2020 semi-final a 'win-win for us'
item.description: Danish fans living in England hope their team can overcome the home side - or do they?

item.title: England v Denmark: Euro 2020 semi-final advice from former Three Lions to current players
item.description: What is it like playing in a semi-final of a major tournament for England? Former players give their advice.

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch with my friends?
item.description: Wembley will host 60,000 fans at England's semi-final, but millions will be watching on TV at home and in pubs.

item.title: Government must clearly communicate Covid rule changes, say psychologists
item.description: Using nuanced language, acknowledging uncertainty and being empathetic are vital, a study suggests.

item.title: Covid: Who has to self-isolate and what if I'm fully vaccinated?
item.description: Self-isolation rules in England are changing from 16 August for under-18s and the double-vaccinated.

item.title: What are the rules about self-isolating, testing and masks in schools?
item.description: From 16 August, under-18s in England will no longer have to self-isolate after exposure to a positive case.

item.title: Vaccine passports: How can I prove I've had both my Covid jabs?
item.description: People with both Covid jabs in England will soon be able to avoid self-isolation and quarantine after travel.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Some firms to insist customers and staff still wear face masks
item.description: Some customers will still be asked to wear face masks even after it becomes a "personal choice" on 19 July.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Boris Johnson has set out government plans for lifting the remaining Covid restrictions in England.

item.title: Covid: Why is social distancing coming to an end?
item.description: The prime minister has announced the next steps for easing social distancing in England.
